data.title: Famous Birthdays on August 31
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 31st of August. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on August 31.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 237

Caligula

3rd Roman Emperor (37-41 AD) who was known for his eccentricity and cruel despotism, born in Anzio, Italy

Commodus

Emperor of Rome (180-192), born in Lanuvium, Italy

Jahangir, 4th Mughal Emperor of India (1605-27), born in Fatehpur Sikri, Mughal Empire (d. 1627)

Amalia, countess of Solms-Braunfels, wife of Frederick Henry, Prince of Orange, born in Braunfels (d. 1675)

Guillaume Amontons, French physicist, born in Paris (d. 1705)

Johann Paul Kunzen, German organist and composer, born in Leisnig, Saxony (d. 1757)

George Hervey, 2nd Earl of Bristol, British statesman (d. 1775)

Husein Gradaščević, Bosniak general, born in Gradačac, Bosnia and Herzegovina (d. 1834)

1741 Johann Paul Aegidius Martini, composer, born in Freystadt, Germany (d. 1816)

Jean-Etienne Despreaux, French ballet dancer and composer, born in Paris (d. 1820)

Alexander Radishchev, Russian writer (Journey from St. Petersburg to Moscow), born in Moscow (d. 1802)

Johann Ignaz Walter, German opera singer and composer, born in Perutz, Bohemia (d. 1822)

François de Paule Jacques Raymond de Fossa, French classical guitarist and composer, born in Perpignan, France (d. 1849)

Goode Bryan, Brigadier General (Confederate Army), born in Hancock County, Georgia (d. 1885)

Hermann von Helmholtz, German physician and physicist, born in Potsdam, Kingdom of Prussia (d. 1894)

Amilcare Ponchielli, Italian composer (I Lituani; La Giaconda), born in Paderno Ponchielli, Italy (d. 1886)

Italian educator (spontaneous response), born in Chiaravalle, Marche, Italy

James E. Ferguson, American Democratic politician and Texan Governor (1915-17), born in Salado, Texas (d. 1944)

Edward Thorndike, American psychologist (father of modern educational psychology), born in Williamsburg, Massachusetts (d. 1949)

Eddie Plank, American Baseball HOF pitcher (World Series 1910, 11, 13 Philadelphia A's), born in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania (d. 1926)

Lizzie Arlington, American baseball pitcher (first woman to play professional men's baseball 1898 Reading Coal Heavers), born in Mahanoy City, Pennsylvania (d. 1919)

Albert Riemenschneider, American pianist, educator, musicologist, and founder of America'a oldest Bach Festival, born in Berea, Ohio (d. 1950)
